content.description: Begin 15 feet left of the central crack (Twin Tank Crack) and just left of the Olson Twins at a crack system. Climb the crack into a left facing corner system and continue to the top.
content.location: Begin 15 feet left of the central crack (Twin Tank Crack) and just left of the Olson Twins at a crack system.

content.description: Start in the same place as Doublemint Twins and climb the obvious central crack system.
content.location: Start in the same place as Doublemint Twins.

content.description: Scramble up on boulders about 40 feet to reach the base of a lower angled slab. Climb past two old ¼ bolts to the top.
content.location: Start to the right of Doublemint Twins.

content.description: Start eight feet left of the central 5.3 crack (Twin Tank Crack) and climb the varnished face to a diagonal crack. Either continue up the grainy face above or move right into the central crack system and follow that to the top.
content.location: Start eight feet left of the central 5.3 crack (Twin Tank Crack).

content.description: 3 bolts to 2 bolt anchor. Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area. SE of the formations. Goes up SW edge of a large dark boulder. Can be seen from Cottonwood Road, out in the distance.
content.location: If you are hiking from the pullout on the Cottonwood Rd., it is the first boulder you come to that has any routes on it. If you are coming from Live Oak, it would be the last.

content.description: This excellent climb ascends a cool face past 5 bolts at the west end of the Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area. The climb faces west.
content.protection: Quick draws only to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: West end of the Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area. The climb faces west and is located just left of a finger shaped spire.

climbs.name: Bumpus Hell
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Beth Shilliday, Bob Spears

content.description: 4 or 5 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. The route ascents "bumps" on a pitted face at Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area ( Formations E. of Hen House). This route faces south and is in the southern Area of the formations. The climbing is interesting enough, although the rock is " less than perfect." The rock is sort of a pretty orange color too.
content.location: Located in the southern section of the Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area. Faces south.

climbs.name: Broke Back Burke
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Woody Stark

content.description: Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area (Formations East of the Hen House) Faces North, has a couple of bolts, and some natural Gear. First bolt is sort of high. 2 bolts on top.
content.protection: Small rack of sm to large.
content.location: In the southern area of Dr. Haney's Tool Shed. The climb faces North. On one of the larger formations in the area.

climbs.name: Baby Tool
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Tucker Tech, Tim Pinar, Brett Pinar

content.description: This route ascends a steep face with plates, then ends with 3 bolts on steep face climbing.
content.protection: Slings and maybe even stoppers/cams to protect the climber through the lower plated section, then quick draws for the bolted top section.  2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: In a secluded cove on the NE section of Dr. Haney's Tool Shed Area. THe climb faces south.
